medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presents with a 3-day history of RUQ pain that started after eating pizza. Initially felt like chest and epigastric pain, but has since progressed to mainly RUQ pain. Symptoms worsened upon returning to the ER, and the patient reported a temperature of 101 at home, along with nausea and vomiting on the first night. Patient denies any chills, upper respiratory infection symptoms, current chest pain, shortness of breath, dysuria, hematuria, or bright red blood per rectum. Mild constipation currently.
